title: McCormick Logs Higher Sales, Gives Soft Full-Year 2026 Outlook
signal_bullets: Q4 sales $1.85B (+2.9%) slightly above consensus; adjusted EPS 86¢ missed consensus 88¢
FY26 guidance $3.05–$3.13 vs Street ~$3.21; management cites tariffs and elevated input costs
mechanism: Tariffs and input-cost inflation raise COGS and compress gross margin; if pricing and productivity gains do not fully offset, earnings guidance falls and the stock reprices immediately.
base_case: Volume holds modestly, pricing benefits continue, enabling low-single-digit organic sales growth (1–3%) while cost actions partially offset tariffs/inflation; earnings land within guided range.
tail_risk: Tariffs or trade costs re-accelerate and/or input inflation persists while pricing power fades, causing further margin compression, another guidance reset, and broader read-through to packaged-food profitability.
action_triggers: Track tariff/trade policy developments and company commentary on cost absorption vs pass-through
Watch gross margin and price/mix progression next quarter
updates_confidence: +0.5 on near-term margin-pressure thesis for consumer staples exposed to tariffs/input costs
